variant.question: Which of the following conditions will give the biggest yawing moment in asymmetric flight ?

options.text: The remaining engine is located far from the CG
The remaining engine is located at the mid-span of the wing
The position of the engine does not influence the yawing moment
The remaining engine is located close to the CG

variant.question: The least ability to oppose the yawing moment from a failed engine occurs when the CG...

options.text: is located at the aft limit of the CG range.
is located at the mid-point, halfway between the forward and aft CG limits.
is located at the forward limit of the CG range.
coincides with the centre of pressure.

variant.question: The strength of the yawing moment caused by an engine failure on a twin-engine aeroplane..

options.text: is independent of the location (fore or aft) of the CG.
will be greater when the CG is located halfway between the forward and aft CG limits.
will be greater when the CG is located at the forward CG limit.
will be greater when the CG is located at the aft CG limit.

variant.question: If an engine fails on a twin engined aeroplane a yawing moment will appear. Which CG location will provide the least ability to oppose this yawing moment?

options.text: When the CG is located at the aft CG limit.
When the CG is located at the forward CG limit.
When the CG is located exactly in the middle between the forward and aft CG limits.
When the CG coincides with the CP (Centre of Pressure).

variant.question: Aircraft has two wing mounted engines, and the thrust asymmetry after an engine failure will lead to a yawing moment. The least ability to oppose the yawing moment created from a failed engine occurs when the CG:

options.text: Is located at the aft limit of the CG range.
Coincides with the centre of pressure.
Is located at the mid-point, halfway between the forward and aft CG limits.
Is located at the forward limit of the CG range.

variant.question: How will CG affect asymmetric yaw?

options.text: CG FWD will reduce yaw
CG FWD will increase yaw
CG AFT will reduce yaw
It is not dependent on CG

variant.question: In order to maintain straight and level flight when you have just lost your critical engine you must:

options.text: rudder and bank towards good engine.
rudder and bank towards dead engine.
bank towards dead engine and rudder towards good engine.
bank towards good engine and rudder towards dead engine.

variant.question: How will the Centre of Gravity (CG) affect asymmetric yaw?

options.text: CG FWD will result in a reduced yaw.
It is independent on CG.
CG FWD will result in an increased yaw.
CG AFT will result in a reduced yaw.

variant.question: The strength of the yawing moment caused by an engine failure on a twin-engine aeroplane will be greater when the distance between the operating engine and the CG (thrust arm) is

options.text: greater
less.
greater than the distance between the rudder and the CG
less than the distance between the rudder and the CG
